page.title: 12WORK IN PORT GLASGOW
page.content: {Port Glasgow}has a population of approx 22,000. Traditionally the men depended heavily on shipbuilding for employment and in particular on the { {Scott Lithgow} complex. Despite massive redundancies recently marine engineering is still the most important local source of employment. Partly as a result of these redundancies male unemployment in Port Glasgow now runs at about 20% Some Port Glaswegians work in electronics firms in Greenock like IBM and National Semiconductors, the latter of which has also experienced recent redundancies. Much of the factory space in Port Glasow's post war{industrial estate}now lies unused. It seems easier for women to find work in Port Glasgow (shops, offices etc) although much of it is part time and poorly paid.
